title: Gerry Round
text:
Gerald "Gerry" V. Round (birth registered second ¼ 1939 – 1 February 1969) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, and at club level for Hebden Bridge ARLFC, and <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 646</a>), as a , i.e. number 1.
Background.
Gerry Round was born in <a href="Hebden%20Bridge">Hebden Bridge</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, England, he was killed in a car crash in <a href="Birkenshaw%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Birkenshaw</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, and his death aged 29 was registered in <a href="Spen%20Valley%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">Spen Valley</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
International honours.
Gerry Round won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for Great Britain while at <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> in 1959 against Australia, and in 1962 against France (2 matches), Australia (3 matches), and New Zealand (2 matches).
Gerry Round achieved the distinction of being Great Britain's full back (v Australia, December, 1959) after only 29 senior games of rugby league football.
Championship Final appearances.
Gerry Round played in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 3-27 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1959–60 season</a> at <a href="Odsal%20Stadium">Odsal Stadium</a>, <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> on Saturday 21 May 1960.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Gerry Round played in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 38-5 victory over <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Challenge%20Cup">1959–60</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1959–60 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 14 May 1960, in front of a crowd of 79,773, played in the 12-6 victory over <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> in the <a href="1961%E2%80%9362%20Challenge%20Cup">1961–62</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1961%E2%80%9362%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1961–62 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 12 May 1962, in front of a crowd of 81,263, and played in the 25-10 victory over <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1962%E2%80%9363%20Challenge%20Cup">1962–63</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1962%E2%80%9363%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1962–63 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 11 May 1963, in front of a crowd of 84,492.
County Cup Final appearances.
Gerry Round played in <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>'s 19-9 victory over <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="1961%E2%80%9362%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1961–62</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1961%E2%80%9362%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1961–62 season</a> at <a href="Odsal%20Stadium">Odsal Stadium</a>, <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> on Saturday 11 November 1961.
Club career.
Gerry Round made his début for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> during March 1958, and he played his last match for Wakefield Trinity during the <a href="1968%E2%80%9369%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1968–69 season</a>, he appears to have scored no drop-goals (or field-goals as they are currently known in Australasia), but prior to the <a href="1974%E2%80%9375%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1974–75 season</a> all goals, whether; <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">conversion</a>s, <a href="Penalty%20%28rugby%29%23Penalties%20in%20rugby%20league">penalties</a>, or <a href="Drop%20goal%23Rugby%20league">drop-goal</a>s, scored 2-points, consequently prior to this date drop-goals were often not explicitly documented, therefore '0' drop-goals may indicate drop-goals not recorded, rather than no drop-goals scored.
Outside of rugby league.
Gerry Round attended <a href="Rishworth%20School">Rishworth School</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a> in the 1950s, before beginning a 3-year <a href="civil%20engineering">civil engineering</a> course at <a href="University%20of%20Leeds">University of Leeds</a> in 1958.
